feel good

I love using this application. I definitely highly recommend this application. I love it I love it.
Does Exactly what it says. FYI: I don't recommend trying it on Microsoft or Google. Lol, gave my phone a stroke.

content: Like it
positive outlook

content: This is pretty useful. One thing I would really like to see implamented is a "content zapper" like ublock orogin uses to get rid of elements that we specifically dont want to see.

Can't find location of stored offline website on Android with paid version as opposed to the free version. Would like the ability to store offline sites on External SD card or even a directory. There should be an ability to tell the program to look in the external SD card or other locations for it's offline data.
replyContent: to see or change folder location, go to Settings->root folder

content: This has potential to be sooo much better. I use this to cache the entire Wuxia World site for chinese light novels and it works great. I wish it had the option to bookmark certain cached pages (in my case links to light novels I'm currently reading) for ease of access. Also another feature that I would like is a "reader" mode which shows only the text of the main articles/documents on a web page.

Hi, very good, very efficient. I bought pro, because I though the "sort" 
function able to sort the links by date/name. Unfortunatly not. Still 
cumbersome to reach latest if using a long list.

This app does what it says. Its very useful. I have downloaded a few large sections of  web sites no problem. Just read the instructions. Can then view offline eg: Bible questions answered etc. Thank you for a great app. I would like to purchase it again to set it a a family app. Please let me know if its possible. Thanks
Ita not working properly, in about 4 hours can't download even single news üì∞ paper site.... Fully disappointed....

content: How to get the results of the download file can be read on a laptop or computer
replyContent: to read the downloaded pages on a computer: 1)disable the option "allow deferred download"; 2) download the site; 3) select the option "Archive"; 4)copy the archive zip file to pc; 5) open the file _h_.html

content: Tried the free version and appeared to work,  so upgraded to pro. Has never worked properly since! Have uninstalled and reinstalled, tried many things. Also started getting the error message "Process system isnt responding" which would cause my Samsung phone to reboot every 15 to 18 minutes with the same error message reappearing. Wasn't sure what was causing that message until my Samsung tablet (which I use very little) developed the exact same error message after installing this program, but hadn't used yet (nothing else had been done with it).  This is what led me to figure our the cause.  Uninstalled this app on both Samsung's and have not had a single reboot OR error message in 2 weeks.  Poor,  poor investment!
replyContent: Hi, the only problem you can have with the PRO version (compared with the free version) is when you enable the scheduling having installed the app in sd card.

content: It is a great idea.  I wish it worked better. The only reason I bought the pro version is the ability to schedule downloads. This feature causes my phone to restart.  It needs to be able to set it to only download 2 sites at a time.  3 or more causes my phone to restart. So it doesn't complete the scheduled download anyway. Too bad that is very inconsistent.  Sometimes it indicates that it downloaded a website but it is the same (not updated news) information from 3 days ago.  Often it fails to download and just doesn't update with no indication why or what to do to make it work next time.  Pictures often do not show up.  Sometimes it works OK and most of the website are there (without most of the pictures).
Quality App, well designed and works great
Not support web with ssl
Does what it needs too.
When I dowloded something it said sorry try next time you did not dowlod you are ofline and I have WiFiüò°

Thank you for adding a notification asking if its OK to download through data. I don't have data overage charges so I'm fine with updating a page. Does the app resume or restart a download that was interrupted? Also, when does a page update? One suggestion is to add the page size in megabytes (MB) or gigabytes (GB) under the date the page was downloaded.
I used this app during a trip to Japan where I had no data. Very useful for downloading documents and guides to access locally!
Thanks for the upgrade. Much better this time
Bought and still using this for months
Very cool
Old lady feeding the birds by the fountain
Been using it for a few days now and is absolutely perfect. Accurately downloads pages.
Easy & fun to use. I use it often & recently purchased the pro version. Thanks devs. I regret nothing.
For some reason every time I start recording a page it freezes

After using it for a few months & compared it with other similar apps, I find it very useful & easy to use, which makes me bought/ upgrade it to the Pro version. The only downside is I can not open the archived file properly in my Windows laptop, all the links inside html file are dead, so all the websites downloaded using this app are confined within it, untransportable, therefore I give 4 out of 5 star. Good job for the developer, I'm waiting for new improvement.
replyContent: if you want to open archived files in laptop you have to disable the option "allow deferred download" before downloading the site

content: It takes forever to organize once you've gotten beyond 50+ pages. Also, the cache folder storage desperately needs date/time stamping (or at least list folder number in edit, so we know where to access specific files).

Works perfectly, and the developer responds to requests for help. If images fail to download, try increase the "max images per site" and "max links per site" and to disable the "clear old pages before download". I had to do this to download the LocusMap manual and then it worked perfectly.
Links dont work

replyContent: if you want to transfer the list from free to pro version, select "backup link list" in free ver. and "restore link list" in PRO. Then you have to copy the content of the folder you find in "root folder" from old to pro

content: Small app, big on options, quickest function!
I use Offline Browser Pro literally every day.  The dev has even helped me a few times.  If you need offline web pages, this is the program you need.

content: PRO browser purchased but it never worked and no help waste of money

content: Great to get the upgrade and avoid seeing ads. I love this app, it works perfectly to save my portfolio website for interviews. I had a minor problem downloading a squarespace site, but Niko fixed it right away!
Correctly downloads web pages. Stable. No monthly or yearly subscription fee.

This app is great I can download all my pages I want to read for on the go and can save some data. My biggest complaint is the sorting they need to fix how you can sort your downloaded pages. It you could sort by date then go back to custom that would be great, until then 3 stars. But of you can overcome this then it's for you and I would recommend it.

Best offline browser I've used, easy to setup, works pretty well without much interaction. I did notice one site had video links but I couldn't see any way to download the video's, also opening the video links within the browser opened up a blank window without video, but I think that's a minor issue.

content: I am getting about a 60% success rate with downloading and viewing pages. Its hit and miss as I can save some pages on the same site which have the same layout. replyContent: Please, send me the non working links using "report link problem". Sometime you can improve download success by properly setting the download parameters.

content: It just works!  I use this for downloading pages and images for backcountry hiking/climbing. I've never had any issues with saving the pages and retrieving them later offline. There are also loads of different options for saving (download images or not, download links (and to what level), etc.). Good job!

Fast download. I read a lot of online books from website. This is by far the best offline reader. I when from lite to paid in no time. But it does crash every now and then with lollipop tho. Hope they will fix it.   Oh by the way person from below. You can backup your web list to a file. On the main page click on setting (top right) then it on the bottom. Backup link.

content: A great app and well maintained. It's also a superb browser for internal websites - in fact the only one that works well.  I author and maintain and html based company database shared in Dropbox. This app along with Dropsync allows it to be used on tablets and phones. Excellent!

content: Download all rarely works.  Setup  a download at 5AM and it can not complete.  Gets maybe 4 out of twelve sites.  Sad really like the idea but so far it's crap

content: Please fix the app issues with External SD. Since KitKat doesn't allow apps to just dump files anywhere the set folder for this app is not working until you set the default to internal SD. Please fix this issue. Thanks
Used free version for a while, then bought pro. THE BEST of its kind, but the price is too steep. Dropped one star on price alone. Anyway, it does the job brilliantly!

Ever since I migrated my Galaxy Note 8 to Kitkat, the app hasn't worked. It downloads the website,  but then apparently can't find the files. Latest email to developer with screen shots hasn't been answered. Can't find any other online sources to resolve this. Anyone else know a fix?
replyContent:
the problem is related to new restrictions on sd card access introduced in Kikat version.
Try to change the root folder (in settings) entering the path to "download" folder in your sd card.

content: I've tried other offline browsing apps but I think this one is the simplest, cleanest, and least buggy of them all. The only problem I have is that I can't access pages that I've logged into. Is there any way to change the settings so that it won't require me to log in every time? I'm mostly using the app for private wordpress sites.
replyContent:
Hi Gabriele, OB PRO has a (beta) function for basic authentication. Try to enter the link to download in that form: http://:@www.site.com
where  and  are your username and password.

content: I reinstalled it and had some suggestions from the developer and it works fine now...thanks Linda B.
replyContent: You're welcome!

content: I use this app daily and fill my phone with articles that I don't have time to read at the time. I bought the pro version just to support the dev. Excellent! Thanks! Galaxy Note 3.

Just needs to auto backup links list to google account so next time I loose my tablet (lets hope there never is a next time), I won't loose all of that savdd research it was well over 100 pages I had saved.

This app saves me tonnes of time! Great for saving and reading articles on the go. Works great on my nexus 7.   The upgrade is definitely worth it, but you can't transfer all of your bookmarks to the new pro version. I had to do this manually. This would be v.handy for users with hundreds of bookmarks :-)  Having the free and pro version open at the same time always crashes the app after some actions.   Apart from that - a great app.
This app is exactly what I was looking for. Initially it would not show the pictures and I emailed dev who was quick to respond. Solution: disable JavaScript. Now everything is working perfectly.

I consider myself the king of offline browsing because I spend 4-5 hours a day browsing my favorite sights, all offline because I'm too cheap to pay for 3G. I use this app combined with 2 others to do what I need. This app doesn't work well for all websites, plus it eats up your memory pretty fast if you are storing lots of huge sites on it. I use it along with Pocket and an RSS reader. Rss is preferable because it doesn't eat up your memory, but it doesn't work for every site either. You have to get to know this app and understand its limitations, but it does what it says it will and is stable if you don't overwhelm it. I wouldn't be able to do what I do without it.

I love keeping up on news, no time to read until I get home. This app allows me to save pages as .html files and enjoy when I have a chance from mobile phone or uploaded to my computer. Saving pages as .pdf's quite frankly stinks - text and images get cut off, and so on - which is the only save option browsers like Firefox allow me to do. OfflineBrowser takes care of all that, and presents pages exactly as a browser should. Wonderful! Buying the pro version here to support the developer. Good job!
I have no regret for buying the Pro version. Well done...Thanks to the Developer...:-D:-D:-D

I use this app to read novel. For The previous version, when I switch to other app and back to offline browser or back from sleep. It will go back to where I read before. This new version it will reload the whole Web page again and I have to search back where I am up to. This is very annoying and "the remember page position" is useless. Also I have to keep click on full page option every time. Any way to get rid of it?
replyContent: In the new version I fixed the screen rotation problems.

content: Brilliant app.  Very useful you haven't got a data connection or in between contracts etc. My only question would be how can I limit the amount of data that this app uses as I starred started to run out of memory and couldn't understand why until I realized that I was using 9gb in offline storage!
replyContent: Hi,thanks for your feedback. To reduce the amount of memory, you can reduce the max files to download in link optiond or sometime use the "clear cache" option (remove the old downloaded files) before download.

content: I paid but it keeps telling me I need to pay. I've emailed but have no response a week later. I just want a refund!
replyContent:
Hi,
Perhaps there was a network problem contacting google server during installation. Normally a re-installation fixes the problem. Anyway I refunded the payment, can you check please?

content: I love this app. This is great for organizing links. Wouldbe nice if it could sync via the cloud in one way or anothern(now one can upload the backup of links to e.g. dropbox)    Categorization of links is why I bought the Pro. Works as advertized. Needs some polishing in the overall interface.

A must have for WiFi only devices when there is no WiFi connection. Just ad sites and configure what you want or down a single page of interest. A one button press to update selected sites via the config of each. "Coffee, press update button, read the sites on the buss later offline."  *NB: Could use a "One site/link at the time" option. App seems to bog down and fail if you try to down to much. 10 sites from 200mb to 500mb doesn't always work for me.
Awesome!
Bought pro version especially for "remember page position". This option does not work. VERY unhappy.  I could have stayed with free version. Plz fix
replyContent:
Hi, have you set the option "remember page position" in settings?
What is the behavior? doesn't remember the position wen you close or when you go back?

content: This is so simple:  Select the web page(s) you want to save, then within the Google menu, select "Share Page" and then various options under "Share via" will appear.  Choose "Offline Browser Pro" and then "OK & dwnld".  Close window, then open Offline Browser Pro  and the page you want to view will be there.  I chose the paid version, because I think good apps should be paid for.  $2.50 is not a deal killer.

I am glad to see this kind of app in the play store, but the developer forgot to  put a button or some kind of pointer that can take us back to the main interface from external browsing. Also, where are the archived pages put and how do I get there from the main interface. Hopefully the developer can bring us folders organization and integration. Make this utility more useful by making it easier for us to access the saved material.

It just works so well for me, I'm using a 'stock' Samsung GNote2 (JB 4.1.2), just type in the websites URL, click 'ok&download' and there it is ready to read when I've no 3G or wireless connection, brill!  The interface a breeze to use, with nothing complicated at all, just choose how deep in 'link' levels you want to go.... Simples!, well done devs.

Both the free and paid versions solve my problem of reading websites offline. However, the UX leaves a lot to be desired. At $2.50, I expected a lot more polish.  If you can tolerate ads (which I can't,) stick with the free version.
The paid version has also a search function which is not working for me. I give 5 stars to support the developer for the great app, but in my opinion the free version is the way to go
Downloaded it, tried it, not great!!
This app lets me quickly read news papers undisturbed by sudden bad coverage due to tunnels etc. Also, it saves about 100mb a month, as news are downloaded over wifi while I sleep.
Dont waste money for pro

I would hate my Nexus 7 without this app. I use it daily to read all my news. I find android news apps don't work very well vs. The ios but this certainly makes up for it.  Developer very responsive, added volume button scroll for me in next release. Emailed me the beta  Thanks Niko
Exactly what I was looking for. Great link depth

No other app lets you download not only the current webpage but all of the links below the top page. Plus all of the excellent options. her downloaded page such as disable JavaScript download images or not, update pages. No other app even comes close this should get a millionaire more download seen it better because its so good. I bought this app within minutes I trusted it immediately
Does anyone know how to make previously downloaded pages with the free version abailable to the Pro version?
Its great a must download app

Saves and stores complete web sites for offline use 4 levels deep. No reformatting, no shannanigans, just the same website what you get online in offline form with pictures an all. Best app ever (lot of options! Make sure you disallow urls with the word facebook! If you don't do that, the app has troubles). Fife bright stars it is! Thanks!
Didn't worked for me

Much better than Instapaper.  You can control how you want to save offline.  Without image, javascript and max. depth level=0, it is likely you only use 50kB per page. (Instapaper does not keep the original format) You can alter the category and title for each page.  It even automatically inserts the storage date for you.   The only rough edge is that it took me some time to figure out how to customize each page (including how to delete the page!) -- You need to hold down the title for more than 1 sec to see the option for each page.
Had problem w current version, emailed him and got a beta sent to me on mail. It now works flawlessly. 4 stars, because there is more work to be done on the fetching technology...
The developer is very responsive, which is worth the purchase of the pro version by itself!
Wish it had the "share with" options.
What a wonderful, feature-rich app! Very intuitive, too. Can't imagine what could make it "better." Desire 2.2
Love that it can save levels of links from each page. Thanks very much for adding user agent option!! ^_^
Great app!
Awesome Dev. And very useful app. Hope to see more apps from him.
Works just as advertised. Simple and efficient. Tops the news readers like google reader or pulse. Lots of options and takes a small amount of space.
Excellent work. The best offline browser. I use it to read newspaper everyday!
